synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves mixing lithium sulfide, diphosphorus pentasulfide, and red phosphorus powders in a glove box under an argon atmosphere, heating the mixture in a quartz tube to 550°C to obtain sample A, grinding the sample in a vibrating mill, heating the ground powder to 950°C to obtain sample B (an amorphized ion conductive material), and further heating the material to 300°C to obtain a sulfide solid electrolyte material with a composition of Li3.75P0.93S4.
